title: Usability Design Strategies for e-Learning in Online Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic internet utilization skills and intermediate expertise in scientific disciplines
context.additional_context: Learning environment for medical/legal/technical professionals utilizing weekends/evenings, with digital devices (tablets/laptops) provided and three weekly online sessions

learning_goals: Learners identify at least three usability issues with 90% accuracy by analyzing an online platform's navigation structure
Learners produce one science content prototype applying differentiated interface design principles by experience level (beginner/intermediate/advanced)
Learners propose three actionable recommendations for platform usability improvements based on formative assessment data

resources: Open educational content for science disciplines

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
